p: where s x and c A are the natural production and loss rate of AST, respectively, and Î± is the rate of AST release by dying infected cells. We assumed four potential mechanisms of action for ribavirin that could (i) act as a mutagen limiting the infectivity of virions; (ii) reduce viral production; (iii) reduce cell loss by limiting inflammation; and (iv) increase cell loss by enhancing antiviral immunity.
